extendedInfo.description: A classic point & click adventure game from Digi-Chain Games!*** As featured in the New York Times article 'Fun, Intrigue and Drama in Touch-Screen Adventures', April 2013 ***NOTE: Requires Android OS 2.3 (API 9+) and above to run.You have received a letter from Uncle Augustus inviting you to Blackrock Lighthouse. He has discovered a great secret on the island and wants to share it with you! But when you arrive Uncle Augustus has disappeared - and it is now down to you to solve the mystery of Blackrock Lighthouse... Features: + A classic point and click adventure game, similar to room escape games.+ Charming hand-illustrated imagery bring the mystery to life.+ An original and unique storyline. + Many items to collect and puzzles to solve. + Game auto-saves as you progress.Note: This game is English language.***** Mystery Lighthouse 2 is now available *****Digi-Chain Games on Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/DigiChainGamesDigi-Chain Games on Twitter:https://twitter.com/DigiChainGames

reviews.title: Solved!
reviews.comment: Nice game but too short. Really makes you think since there are no hints to help you solve the puzzles.

reviews.title: Crash
reviews.comment: My game crashes right after the digi-games logo, I didn\'t even get to see what the game is like. I\'m on a Samsung Galaxy Y which uses Android 2.3.6, please fix.
reviews.author: Sergio Insaurralde

reviews.title: What is it downloading?
reviews.comment: After downloading 13+ mb I find that after playing for a while it has used 5 mb. What is it downloading, not that amount of data on ads surely! Size of the app is sufficient for the limited graphics and music.  Seems very odd?

reviews.author: shrinivas kulkarni

reviews.title: A lot of fun!
reviews.comment: This is a good \"Myst\" style adventure game. It\'s puzzles are pretty good and are fairly logical. It runs really well on my Samsung Rush which is a lower to medium end phone, so it\'s system requirements are not outrageous. It\'s a little short, I would think most would finish this in just a one to two hour period, but it\'s a freebie so what\'s to complain about.
reviews.author: Warren Hunt

reviews.title: Great Beginner Game
reviews.comment: My 5-year-old and I played this together, and it was a perfect introduction to the adventure game genre. The graphics are reminiscent of children\'s book illustrations, and the music is like that of a music box. No zombies, no blood, no scary stuff. The puzzles were well done but fairly simple, and the ending was a bit of a surprise.  My only complaint about this game is that the pages loaded slowly. It wasn\'t enough to take away from game play, but it was noticeable. If you\'re playing with a child, though, things are probably already going slower than usual, so it\'s not a big deal.  The price is good, the permissions are minimal, and the story is cute. Highly recommended. We can\'t wait to play the second one!
reviews.author: Jennifer Racine

reviews.title: Not good
reviews.comment: Didn\'t even open passed the very first opening screen.
reviews.author: Telle Braddock
